description: From the Latin propitiātōrius (“atoning; reconciling, propitiating”).

adjectives.description: propitiatory (comparative more propitiatory, superlative most propitiatory)

entries.meaning: Intended to propitiate, reconcile, expiate or appease; conciliatory.
examples: Hecatombs were early substituted for single victims; and, to render the worship still more propitiatory, these were soon exchanged for human sacrifices.
